reviewText: Ford was a great pictorial director whose portraits of the American West were powerful renderings of the  westering myth.  Yes, his films were often sentimental but nonetheless conveyed much that is distinctively American, and yes, they never failed to tell a good story.  This tribute was deserved.
The video quality must have been awful before the re-master. It was good to see some of the off camera things and the stars. But the video quality is pretty poor,

This is a great piece on one of the greatest directors ever.  John Ford brought terrific performances out of his cast and there is no picture of his that was bad.  This video offers a glimpse of his style and shows the respect his actors had for him.
It's an old documentary and not very detail on him, more fluff then anything else. It feels like a thank you and good bye by some of his big star actors that he had work with over his carrier.
ok but not great
Dated, but I would watch John Wayne, Henry Fonda, and James Stewart with John Ford all in one film water cactus.
Very low quality for a digitally remastered.
Shows the location John Ford used to make his westerns and tells about John Wayne and all the other great actors  , Loved the History of John Ford

First of all, this hasn't been "remastered." This is taken from the same old analog video master seen on various PD DVDs. Having said that, it's a must-see documentary. 3 stars because of the false advertising about being remastered.
Wonderful insight into an icon. I love Westerns and especially Ford Westerns. They give us a great look into our heritage.
As others have said, video quality is only fair but a nice video
Very entertaining!!!
Interesting

Is this old, yes.  Is this low quality video, yes  Is this loaded with insights about John Ford, kind of.  Is it great to see him talk with his greatest stars, Absolutely.  Nothing groundbreaking here but it sure is nice to have a glimpse into a filmaking time gone by.  I believe there is another more updated documentary somewhere out there.  But this will do for now.
ok, would have been better if it was more about Ford.
For the older audience and fan of the westerns, it was great for the memories.
So good to see the Duke, Jimmy Stewart and Hank Fonda talking with Pappy. Legendary stuff!
This was nice to see. John Ford was a fine director, and did many  terrific movies, especially westerns. To see John Wayne, Jimmy Stewart, Henry Fonda, and others, comment about this man was a treat.
Nice
Kind of boring.
Just with this had been shot in HD, but if you are a fan of John ford's movies, Hollywood Western movie history, John Wayne, Jimmy Stewart or Henry Fonda, this is a must see documentary.

If you are looking for a documentary on legendary film maker John Ford, I suggest you make this your last stop.  Directed by John Ford is the superior film, there is also Becoming John Ford, and a couple of other wonderful documentaries on this 6 x Oscar winning director. Am I happy to own this though?  Yes, although the digitally remastered part should be taken with a grain (pun intended).  While the most excellent Directed by John Ford was dramatically remastered and updated , this wasn't in any way ... it should be called digitally transferred.  But I am happy to own this DVD-R as it does have some footage of Mr Ford, John Wayne, Henry Fonda and Jimmy Stewart I don't already own and as a big fan of them all and that era it lived up to my expectations.
nice to know some history about John Ford
John Ford meets Marion Morrison.
Never to be replicated, this man John Ford.  If you love the southwest, watch this.
Great perspective in the contrast between the reality of the cowboy culture and the American West of John Ford.
No comment, just watched it cuz I was curious.
My husband loved this show.
While the technical quality was mediocre, the substantive and nostalgic value was tremendous. I have purchased another as a gift.

This man directed some of the greatest movies in the past. John Ford was a very interesting man. He made movies his way by pushing the actors in his films to portray the characters as he saw the story unfold.
The film shows the man & his type of movies & how he directed some of best actors around at that time.
Interviews with John Wayne, Jimmy Stewart & Henry Fonda.

Ford has left a legacy of some of the greatest motion pictures, especially Westerns. He also filmed edited and produced the marvelous footage of the Battle of Midway (June'42) What more can one say of this giant of the film industry?
i enjoyed this film  and would watch it again i have looked at this item  a few times thank you
Somewhat grainy, but that's standard for the era.  Lots of interviews and commentary from the likes of actors we'll never see again.
Easy purchase experiance. Exactly what i wanted.
A little dated and mostly lip service to John Ford by his actors but still entertaining.
Great
Poor quality of color but great story.
This TV special from about 1970 is virtually information-free. If you're looking to learn more about John Ford, there are numerous other documentaries that are far better.
If you don't like John Wayne, don't bother.  However, if you like westerns and John Wayne, Jimmy Stewart, and Henry Fonda, WELL worth the watch.  My only complaint was that it was too short.
It was really interesting and revealing.
Excellent Hollywood documentary.

This documentary is promoted as being 'digitally remastered' however it is barely watchable! The film is very grainy and unclear and certainly does not appear to have been remastered. Very disappointing, and certainly would not recommend it to potential buyers as there are much better and finer examples of biographies available on John Ford.
Quirky and interesting. But strange to view the attitude to Native Americans. Not PC but accurate portrayal of  American mid century attitude. One must reflect.
